result.execSummary:
The defendant Dimitri L Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge. Pay all court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 07-20-17; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
COURT MAKES THE DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE TO HAVE THIS CASE EXPUNGED AFTER SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE SENTENCE

- No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Work or school.
- Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course.
- Successfully complete a parenting course.
- No Contact with Dangelo L.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dimitri L Hart in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 4 days, STRAIGHT TIME. IMPOSED and STAYED. The Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS.   
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-90 days in the House of Correction, with release for work, school, AODA treatment and work crew
-No violations of State or Federal law that rise to the level of probable cause
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Work or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification course
-Successfully complete a parenting course
-No contact with Deangelo L.
-No drivers license suspension
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/20/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/20/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment 
**Court makes the defendant eligible to have this case expunged after successful completion of the sentence
 Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Dimitri L Hart in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 6/2/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Dimitri L Hart in court with attorney David M. Kaiser.  Ronald Dague for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Deanglo L.; Martrell N. or Jaiquan T

Defendant Dimitri L Hart in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Dimitri L Hart in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
